title: ICE: check::method::suggest::report_error::report_candidates

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
This code causes an ICE.

``` rust
trait Shape { fn area(&self) -> f64;}

trait Circle : Shape {
    fn radius(&self) -> f64;
    fn area(&self) -> f64 {
        self.radius().powf(2.0) * 3.14
    }
}

struct MyCircle;

impl Shape for MyCircle { }
impl Circle for MyCircle { fn radius (&self) -> f64 { 2.0 } }

fn main() {
    let b = MyCircle;
    println!("{}",b.area());
}
```

``` bash
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc test.rs
test.rs:12:1: 12:28 error: not all trait items implemented, missing: `area` [E0046]
test.rs:12 impl Shape for MyCircle { }
           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
test.rs:17:21: 17:27 error: multiple applicable methods in scope [E0034]
test.rs:17     println!("{}",b.area());
                               ^~~~~~
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```
